response:
The combination of subacute optic neuritis and cerebellar ataxia in a young female is the classic presentation of a demyelinating disorder. Multiple Sclerosis is the primary differential. Atypical inflammatory demyelinating diseases (NMOSD, MOGAD) and systemic inflammatory/infectious etiologies must be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis (Clinically Isolated Syndrome or Relapse)", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (NMOSD)", "MOG Antibody Disease (MOGAD)", "Neuro-sarcoidosis", "CNS Vasculitis", "Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM)", "CNS Lymphoma"]
